content: radiating star blanket difficulty beginner finished size 42 inches in diameter suggested yarn 5 balls of patons shetland chunky 75% acrylic 25% wool approx 121 yards 111 meters per 100 grams 3 53 ounces in taupe needles size 10 us 6 mm circular and double pointed needles adjust needle size if necessary to obtain gauge notions stitch markers tapestry needle gauge 15 stitches = 4 inches in stockinette stitch pattern cast on 8 stitches and distribute evenly on alexis layton double pointed needles continue knitting by this circular blanket is the ideal size for warming your lap following either the on a cool evening or swaddling a small child it knits up written instructions or quickly in the round using chunky yarn the repetition of the included chart the radiating arms of the star is easy to follow once change to circular established eyelet edging prevents the edges from curling needles when necessary © 2008 alexis layton alexislayton com all rights reserved radiating star blanket 1 abbreviations k = knit yo = yarn over k2tog = knit 2 together skp = slip 1 knit 1 pass the slipped stitch over written instructions knit all even row instructions below are for one repeat of
